meanings.definition: A whale that lifts its tail flukes out of the water and slaps them on the surface.
meanings.sent1: The lobtail of the whale was a spectacular sight as it lifted its tail flukes high.
meanings.sent2: Whales often perform a lobtail to communicate with others in their pod.
meanings.sent3: The playful whale lobtailed to splash water on its friends nearby.
meanings.sent4: The lobtail of the whale echoed across the ocean, a rhythmic drumbeat of nature.
meanings.sent5: Children on the boat cheered as they witnessed the majestic lobtail of the whale.

meanings.definition: To strike the surface of the water with the tail flukes, as a whale.
meanings.sent1: The whale will lobtail to create a loud noise in the water.
meanings.sent2: When excited, the whale may lobtail to express its emotions.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous whale lobtailed to startle the nearby fish.
meanings.sent4: The whale lobtailed with such force that the water sprayed everywhere.
meanings.sent5: Tourists gasped in amazement as they watched the whale lobtail right beside their boat.

meanings.definition: A blow or slap with the tail, as a whale.
meanings.sent1: The lobtail of the whale could be heard from afar, a distinctive sound.
meanings.sent2: After a successful hunt, the whale celebrated with a lobtail.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy whale accidentally gave itself a lobtail while trying to dive.
meanings.sent4: The powerful lobtail of the whale sent ripples through the calm ocean.
meanings.sent5: Witnessing a lobtail up close made the onlookers feel the raw power of nature.
